snippet: Six of 12 services industries reported contraction in November but economists said that did not signal a slowdown in G.D.P.
abstract: Institute for Supply Management says its index of nonmanufacturing activity fell to 55.9 in November from 59.1 in October; Labor Department reports initial claims for state unemployment benefits in week ended Nov 28 rose 9,000 to seasonally adjusted 269,000.
lead_paragraph: Six of 12 services industries reported contraction in November but economists said that did not signal a slowdown in G.D.P.

headline.main: Services Sector Slips, but Growth Remains Stable
headline.print_headline: Slowdown Hits the Services Sector, but Economic Growth Remains Stable
